data.name: StringFormatAnalyzerTitle
data.value: Use TextTools.FormatString() instead of string.Format()

data.name: StringFormatAnalyzerMessageFormat
data.value: Caller uses string.Format() instead of TextTools.FormatString()

data.name: StringFormatAnalyzerDescription
data.value: TextTools.FormatString() uses the error handler to handle unknown formatting errors and returns the unformatted string if such errors happen, but string.Format() immediately throws.

data.name: ConsoleWrapperUsageAnalyzerTitle
data.value: Use ConsoleWrapper instead of Console

data.name: ConsoleWrapperUsageAnalyzerMessageFormat
data.value: Caller uses Console instead of ConsoleWrapper

data.name: ConsoleWrapperUsageAnalyzerDescription
data.value: ConsoleWrapper makes sure that your console is not a dumb console. This class is a wrapper for the Console class so that it works cross-platform, while Console contains some platform-dependent APIs.

data.name: ConsoleTitleUsageAnalyzerTitle
data.value: Use SetTitle() instead of Console.Title

data.name: ConsoleTitleUsageAnalyzerMessageFormat
data.value: Caller uses Console.Title instead of SetTitle()

data.name: ConsoleTitleUsageAnalyzerDescription
data.value: SetTitle() uses the VT sequence to set the title, while Console.Title works in certain conditions.

data.name: ConsoleForeColorUsageAnalyzerTitle
data.value: Use SetConsoleColor(Color) instead of Console.ForegroundColor

data.name: ConsoleForeColorUsageAnalyzerMessageFormat
data.value: Caller uses Console.ForegroundColor instead of SetConsoleColor(Color)

data.name: ConsoleForeColorUsageAnalyzerDescription
data.value: SetConsoleColor(Color) not only brings better color support provided by the appropriate VT sequences, but it can also use true color. Console.ForegroundColor only handles 16 colors.

data.name: ConsoleBackColorUsageAnalyzerTitle
data.value: Use SetConsoleColor(Color, true) instead of Console.BackgroundColor

data.name: ConsoleBackColorUsageAnalyzerMessageFormat
data.value: Caller uses Console.BackgroundColor instead of SetConsoleColor(Color, true)

data.name: ConsoleBackColorUsageAnalyzerDescription
data.value: SetConsoleColor(Color, true) not only brings better color support provided by the appropriate VT sequences, but it can also use true color. Console.BackgroundColor only handles 16 colors.

data.name: ConsoleReadLineUsageAnalyzerTitle
data.value: Use ReadLine() instead of Console.ReadLine

data.name: ConsoleReadLineUsageAnalyzerMessageFormat
data.value: Caller uses Console.ReadLine instead of ReadLine()

data.name: ConsoleReadLineUsageAnalyzerDescription
data.value: ReadLine() provided by the input helper from Nitrocid allows you to seamlessly read a user input with settings provided by Terminaux.

data.name: ConsoleWriteUsageAnalyzerTitle
data.value: Use TWC.Write() instead of Console.Write

data.name: ConsoleWriteUsageAnalyzerMessageFormat
data.value: Caller uses Console.Write instead of TWC.Write()

data.name: ConsoleWriteUsageAnalyzerDescription
data.value: TextWriterColor.Write() contains workarounds for VT sequences needed for Linux hosts to properly report the correct position post-write. Its overloads also allow you to specify the color and the line writing.

data.name: ConsoleWriteLineUsageAnalyzerTitle
data.value: Use TWC.Write() instead of Console.WriteLine

data.name: ConsoleWriteLineUsageAnalyzerMessageFormat
data.value: Caller uses Console.WriteLine instead of TWC.Write()

data.name: ConsoleWriteLineUsageAnalyzerDescription
data.value: TextWriterColor.Write() contains workarounds for VT sequences needed for Linux hosts to properly report the correct position post-write. Its overloads also allow you to specify the color and the line writing.

data.name: ConsoleResetColorUsageAnalyzerTitle
data.value: Use ConsoleExtensions.ResetColors() instead of Console.ResetColor

data.name: ConsoleResetColorUsageAnalyzerMessageFormat
data.value: Caller uses Console.ResetColor instead of ConsoleExtensions.ResetColors()

data.name: ConsoleResetColorUsageAnalyzerDescription
data.value: ConsoleExtensions.ResetColors() contains VT sequences that help reset colors in a portable way.

data.name: DirectoryGetFileSystemEntriesUsageAnalyzerTitle
data.value: Use Listing.CreateList() instead of Directory.GetFileSystemEntries

data.name: DirectoryGetFileSystemEntriesUsageAnalyzerMessageFormat
data.value: Caller uses Directory.GetFileSystemEntries instead of Listing.CreateList()

data.name: DirectoryGetFileSystemEntriesUsageAnalyzerDescription
data.value: Listing.CreateList() returns a list of FileSystemEntry instances that provides you information about a file, as well as a wrapper to the FileSystemInfo instance for that file.

data.name: DirectoryGetFileSystemEntriesAltUsageAnalyzerTitle
data.value: Use Listing.GetFileSystemEntries() instead of Directory.GetFileSystemEntries

data.name: DirectoryGetFileSystemEntriesAltUsageAnalyzerMessageFormat
data.value: Caller uses Directory.GetFileSystemEntries instead of Listing.GetFileSystemEntries()

data.name: DirectoryGetFileSystemEntriesAltUsageAnalyzerDescription
data.value: Alternatively, Listing.GetFileSystemEntries() returns a list of paths to files or folders with better support for patterns. You can also use GetFilesystemEntriesRegex() for regular expression support.

data.name: FileCopyUsageAnalyzerTitle
data.value: Use Copying.CopyFileOrDir() instead of File.Copy

data.name: FileCopyUsageAnalyzerMessageFormat
data.value: Caller uses File.Copy instead of Copying.CopyFileOrDir()

data.name: FileCopyUsageAnalyzerDescription
data.value: Copying.CopyFileOrDir() neutralizes the provided paths to their absolute correct paths, while File.Copy operates at the executable directory (Environment.CurrentDirectory), which may not be what you want.

data.name: DirectoryCreateDirectoryUsageAnalyzerTitle
data.value: Use Making.MakeDirectory() instead of Directory.CreateDirectory

data.name: DirectoryCreateDirectoryUsageAnalyzerMessageFormat
data.value: Caller uses Directory.CreateDirectory instead of Making.MakeDirectory()

data.name: DirectoryCreateDirectoryUsageAnalyzerDescription
data.value: Making.MakeDirectory() neutralizes the provided path to its absolute correct path, while Directory.CreateDirectory operates at the executable directory (Environment.CurrentDirectory), which may not be what you want.

data.name: FileCreateUsageAnalyzerTitle
data.value: Use Making.MakeFile() instead of File.Create

data.name: FileCreateUsageAnalyzerMessageFormat
data.value: Caller uses File.Create instead of Making.MakeFile()

data.name: FileCreateUsageAnalyzerDescription
data.value: Making.MakeFile() neutralizes the provided path to its absolute correct path, while File.Create operates at the executable directory (Environment.CurrentDirectory), which may not be what you want.

data.name: FileMoveUsageAnalyzerTitle
data.value: Use Moving.MoveFileOrDir() instead of File.Move

data.name: FileMoveUsageAnalyzerMessageFormat
data.value: Caller uses File.Move instead of Moving.MoveFileOrDir()

data.name: FileMoveUsageAnalyzerDescription
data.value: Moving.MoveFileOrDir() neutralizes the provided paths to their absolute correct paths, while File.Move operates at the executable directory (Environment.CurrentDirectory), which may not be what you want.

data.name: FileDeleteUsageAnalyzerTitle
data.value: Use Removing.RemoveFile() instead of File.Delete

data.name: FileDeleteUsageAnalyzerMessageFormat
data.value: Caller uses File.Delete instead of Removing.RemoveFile()

data.name: FileDeleteUsageAnalyzerDescription
data.value: Removing.RemoveFile() neutralizes the provided path to its absolute correct path, while File.Delete operates at the executable directory (Environment.CurrentDirectory), which may not be what you want.

data.name: DirectoryDeleteUsageAnalyzerTitle
data.value: Use Removing.RemoveDirectory() instead of Directory.Delete

data.name: DirectoryDeleteUsageAnalyzerMessageFormat
data.value: Caller uses Directory.Delete instead of Removing.RemoveDirectory()

data.name: DirectoryDeleteUsageAnalyzerDescription
data.value: Removing.RemoveDirectory() neutralizes the provided path to its absolute correct path, while Directory.Delete operates at the executable directory (Environment.CurrentDirectory), which may not be what you want.

data.name: FileExistsUsageAnalyzerTitle
data.value: Use Checking.FileExists() instead of File.Exists

data.name: FileExistsUsageAnalyzerMessageFormat
data.value: Caller uses File.Exists instead of Checking.FileExists()

data.name: FileExistsUsageAnalyzerDescription
data.value: Checking.FileExists() neutralizes the provided path to its absolute correct path, while File.Exists operates at the executable directory (Environment.CurrentDirectory), which may not be what you want.

data.name: DirectoryExistsUsageAnalyzerTitle
data.value: Use Checking.DirectoryExists() instead of Directory.Exists

data.name: DirectoryExistsUsageAnalyzerMessageFormat
data.value: Caller uses Directory.Exists instead of Checking.DirectoryExists()

data.name: DirectoryExistsUsageAnalyzerDescription
data.value: Checking.DirectoryExists() neutralizes the provided path to its absolute correct path, while Directory.Exists operates at the executable directory (Environment.CurrentDirectory), which may not be what you want.

data.name: PathExistsUsageAnalyzerTitle
data.value: Use Checking.Exists() instead of Path.Exists

data.name: PathExistsUsageAnalyzerMessageFormat
data.value: Caller uses Path.Exists instead of Checking.Exists()

data.name: PathExistsUsageAnalyzerDescription
data.value: Checking.Exists() neutralizes the provided path to its absolute correct path, while Path.Exists operates at the executable Path (Environment.CurrentPath), which may not be what you want.

data.name: PathIsPathRootedUsageAnalyzerTitle
data.value: Use Checking.Rooted() instead of Path.IsPathRooted

data.name: PathIsPathRootedUsageAnalyzerMessageFormat
data.value: Caller uses Path.IsPathRooted instead of Checking.Rooted()

data.name: PathIsPathRootedUsageAnalyzerDescription
data.value: Checking.Rooted() uses the filesystem driver to call Path.IsPathRooted.

data.name: PathGetInvalidPathCharsUsageAnalyzerTitle
data.value: Use Parsing.GetInvalidPathChars() instead of Path.GetInvalidPathChars

data.name: PathGetInvalidPathCharsUsageAnalyzerMessageFormat
data.value: Caller uses Path.GetInvalidPathChars instead of Parsing.GetInvalidPathChars()

data.name: PathGetInvalidPathCharsUsageAnalyzerDescription
data.value: Parsing.GetInvalidPathChars() always returns invalid characters for Windows paths, regardless of the host operating system, while Path.GetInvalidPathChars returns a list of forbidden path characters for an operating system, which may be wrong in .NET 6.0 or later for the following characters: '"', '<', '>'.

data.name: PathGetFullPathUsageAnalyzerTitle
data.value: Use Filesystem.NeutralizePath() instead of Path.GetFullPath

data.name: PathGetFullPathUsageAnalyzerMessageFormat
data.value: Caller uses Path.GetFullPath instead of Filesystem.NeutralizePath()

data.name: PathGetFullPathUsageAnalyzerDescription
data.value: Filesystem.NeutralizePath() neutralizes the provided path to its absolute correct path, but also gives a path separated by the platform-agnostic path separator.

data.name: TimeZoneInfoLocalUsageAnalyzerTitle
data.value: Use TimeZones.GetCurrentZoneInfo() instead of TimeZoneInfo.Local

data.name: TimeZoneInfoLocalUsageAnalyzerMessageFormat
data.value: Caller uses TimeZoneInfo.Local instead of TimeZones.GetCurrentZoneInfo()

data.name: TimeZoneInfoLocalUsageAnalyzerDescription
data.value: TimeZones.GetCurrentZoneInfo() gets your local time zone and respects your kernel settings based on that. It either gets your local time zone from your system or from your kernel configuration.

data.name: KernelDateTimeToTimeStringUsageAnalyzerTitle
data.value: Use TimeDateRenderers.RenderTime() instead of TimeDateTools.KernelDateTime.ToString

data.name: KernelDateTimeToTimeStringUsageAnalyzerMessageFormat
data.value: Caller uses TimeDateTools.KernelDateTime.ToString instead of TimeDateRenderers.RenderTime()

data.name: KernelDateTimeToTimeStringUsageAnalyzerDescription
data.value: TimeDateRenderers.RenderTime() respects your kernel settings when rendering time.

data.name: KernelDateTimeToDateStringUsageAnalyzerTitle
data.value: Use TimeDateRenderers.RenderDate() instead of TimeDateTools.KernelDateTime.ToString

data.name: KernelDateTimeToDateStringUsageAnalyzerMessageFormat
data.value: Caller uses TimeDateTools.KernelDateTime.ToString instead of TimeDateRenderers.RenderDate()

data.name: KernelDateTimeToDateStringUsageAnalyzerDescription
data.value: TimeDateRenderers.RenderDate() respects your kernel settings when rendering date.

data.name: KernelDateTimeToStringUsageAnalyzerTitle
data.value: Use TimeDateRenderers.Render() instead of TimeDateTools.KernelDateTime.ToString

data.name: KernelDateTimeToStringUsageAnalyzerMessageFormat
data.value: Caller uses TimeDateTools.KernelDateTime.ToString instead of TimeDateRenderers.Render()

data.name: KernelDateTimeToStringUsageAnalyzerDescription
data.value: TimeDateRenderers.Render() respects your kernel settings when rendering date and time.

data.name: KernelDateTimeToTimeStringUtcUsageAnalyzerTitle
data.value: Use TimeDateRenderersUtc.RenderTimeUtc() instead of TimeDateTools.KernelDateTimeUtc.ToString

data.name: KernelDateTimeToTimeStringUtcUsageAnalyzerMessageFormat
data.value: Caller uses TimeDateTools.KernelDateTimeUtc.ToString instead of TimeDateRenderersUtc.RenderTimeUtc()

data.name: KernelDateTimeToTimeStringUtcUsageAnalyzerDescription
data.value: TimeDateRenderersUtc.RenderTimeUtc() respects your kernel settings when rendering time.

data.name: KernelDateTimeToDateStringUtcUsageAnalyzerTitle
data.value: Use TimeDateRenderersUtc.RenderDateUtc() instead of TimeDateTools.KernelDateTimeUtc.ToString

data.name: KernelDateTimeToDateStringUtcUsageAnalyzerMessageFormat
data.value: Caller uses TimeDateTools.KernelDateTimeUtc.ToString instead of TimeDateRenderersUtc.RenderDateUtc()

data.name: KernelDateTimeToDateStringUtcUsageAnalyzerDescription
data.value: TimeDateRenderersUtc.RenderDateUtc() respects your kernel settings when rendering date.

data.name: KernelDateTimeToStringUtcUsageAnalyzerTitle
data.value: Use TimeDateRenderersUtc.RenderUtc() instead of TimeDateTools.KernelDateTimeUtc.ToString

data.name: KernelDateTimeToStringUtcUsageAnalyzerMessageFormat
data.value: Caller uses TimeDateTools.KernelDateTimeUtc.ToString instead of TimeDateRenderersUtc.RenderUtc()

data.name: KernelDateTimeToStringUtcUsageAnalyzerDescription
data.value: TimeDateRenderersUtc.RenderUtc() respects your kernel settings when rendering date and time.

data.name: PlatformIdWin32NtUsageAnalyzerTitle
data.value: Use KernelPlatform.IsOnWindows() instead of Environment.OSVersion.Platform == PlatformID.Win32NT

data.name: PlatformIdWin32NtUsageAnalyzerMessageFormat
data.value: Caller uses Environment.OSVersion.Platform == PlatformID.Win32NT instead of KernelPlatform.IsOnWindows()

data.name: PlatformIdWin32NtUsageAnalyzerDescription
data.value: KernelPlatform.IsOnWindows() is more readable and less verbose than Environment.OSVersion.Platform == PlatformID.Win32NT.

data.name: PlatformIdUnixUsageAnalyzerTitle
data.value: Use KernelPlatform.IsOnUnix() instead of Environment.OSVersion.Platform == PlatformID.Unix

data.name: PlatformIdUnixUsageAnalyzerMessageFormat
data.value: Caller uses Environment.OSVersion.Platform == PlatformID.Unix instead of KernelPlatform.IsOnUnix()

data.name: PlatformIdUnixUsageAnalyzerDescription
data.value: KernelPlatform.IsOnUnix() is more readable and less verbose than Environment.OSVersion.Platform == PlatformID.Unix.

data.name: IsOsPlatformWindowsUsageAnalyzerTitle
data.value: Use KernelPlatform.IsOnWindows() instead of RuntimeInformation.IsOSPlatform(OSPlatform.Windows)

data.name: IsOsPlatformWindowsUsageAnalyzerMessageFormat
data.value: Caller uses RuntimeInformation.IsOSPlatform(OSPlatform.Windows) instead of KernelPlatform.IsOnWindows()

data.name: IsOsPlatformWindowsUsageAnalyzerDescription
data.value: KernelPlatform.IsOnWindows() is more readable and less verbose than RuntimeInformation.IsOSPlatform(OSPlatform.Windows).

data.name: IsOsPlatformLinuxUsageAnalyzerTitle
data.value: Use KernelPlatform.IsOnUnix() instead of RuntimeInformation.IsOSPlatform(OSPlatform.Linux)

data.name: IsOsPlatformLinuxUsageAnalyzerMessageFormat
data.value: Caller uses RuntimeInformation.IsOSPlatform(OSPlatform.Linux) instead of KernelPlatform.IsOnUnix()

data.name: IsOsPlatformLinuxUsageAnalyzerDescription
data.value: KernelPlatform.IsOnUnix() is more readable and less verbose than RuntimeInformation.IsOSPlatform(OSPlatform.Linux).

data.name: IsOsPlatformOSXUsageAnalyzerTitle
data.value: Use KernelPlatform.IsOnMacOS() instead of RuntimeInformation.IsOSPlatform(OSPlatform.OSX)

data.name: IsOsPlatformOSXUsageAnalyzerMessageFormat
data.value: Caller uses RuntimeInformation.IsOSPlatform(OSPlatform.OSX) instead of KernelPlatform.IsOnMacOS()

data.name: IsOsPlatformOSXUsageAnalyzerDescription
data.value: KernelPlatform.IsOnMacOS() is more readable and less verbose than RuntimeInformation.IsOSPlatform(OSPlatform.OSX).

data.name: TermProgramUsageAnalyzerTitle
data.value: Use KernelPlatform.GetTerminalEmulator() instead of Environment.GetEnvironmentVariable("TERM_PROGRAM")

data.name: TermProgramUsageAnalyzerMessageFormat
data.value: Caller uses Environment.GetEnvironmentVariable("TERM_PROGRAM") instead of KernelPlatform.GetTerminalEmulator()

data.name: TermProgramUsageAnalyzerDescription
data.value: KernelPlatform.GetTerminalEmulator() is more readable and less verbose than Environment.GetEnvironmentVariable("TERM_PROGRAM").

data.name: TermUsageAnalyzerTitle
data.value: Use KernelPlatform.GetTerminalType() instead of Environment.GetEnvironmentVariable("TERM")

data.name: TermUsageAnalyzerMessageFormat
data.value: Caller uses Environment.GetEnvironmentVariable("TERM") instead of KernelPlatform.GetTerminalType()

data.name: TermUsageAnalyzerDescription
data.value: KernelPlatform.GetTerminalType() is more readable and less verbose than Environment.GetEnvironmentVariable("TERM").

data.name: TmuxUsageAnalyzerTitle
data.value: Use KernelPlatform.IsRunningFromTmux() instead of Environment.GetEnvironmentVariable("TMUX")

data.name: TmuxUsageAnalyzerMessageFormat
data.value: Caller uses Environment.GetEnvironmentVariable("TMUX") instead of KernelPlatform.IsRunningFromTmux()

data.name: TmuxUsageAnalyzerDescription
data.value: KernelPlatform.IsRunningFromTmux() is more readable and less verbose than Environment.GetEnvironmentVariable("TMUX").

data.name: ScreenUsageAnalyzerTitle
data.value: Use KernelPlatform.IsRunningFromScreen() instead of Environment.GetEnvironmentVariable("STY")

data.name: ScreenUsageAnalyzerMessageFormat
data.value: Caller uses Environment.GetEnvironmentVariable("STY") instead of KernelPlatform.IsRunningFromScreen()

data.name: ScreenUsageAnalyzerDescription
data.value: KernelPlatform.IsRunningFromScreen() is more readable and less verbose than Environment.GetEnvironmentVariable("STY").
